repo/ros/storage_account_provider.description: Location where dump file will be saved. Used by dump recipes to back up to Amazon S3 or Rackspace Cloud Files.

repo/ros/storage_account_id.description: In order to write the dump file to the specified cloud storage location, you need to provide cloud authentication credentials. For Amazon S3, use your Amazon access key ID (e.g., cred:AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID). For Rackspace Cloud Files, use your Rackspace login username (e.g., cred:RACKSPACE_USERNAME).

repo/ros/storage_account_secret.description: In order to write the dump file to the specified cloud storage location, you will need to provide cloud authentication credentials. For Amazon S3, use your AWS secret access key (e.g., cred:AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY). For Rackspace Cloud Files, use your Rackspace account API key (e.g., cred:RACKSPACE_AUTH_KEY).

repo/ros/container.description: The cloud storage location where the dump file will be saved to or restored from. For Amazon S3, use the bucket name. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use the container name.

repo/ros/prefix.description: The prefix that will be used to name/locate the backup of a particular database dump. Defines the prefix of the dump file name that will be used to name the backup database dump file, along with a timestamp.

repo/default.description: Common settings for managing a source repository

repo/svn.description: Settings for managing a Svn source repository

repo/git.description: Settings for managing a Git source repository

repo/ros.description: Settings for managing a ROS source repository

recipes.repo::default: Default recipe for setup resources provided
recipes.repo::do_pull: Recipe for pulling project repos from svn, git or ros. Your source will be available in /tmp/repo
